Teaching Cases & Tools

Mayor Curtatone’s Culture of Curiosity: Building Data Capabilities at Somerville City Hall

Lisa C. Cox and Jorrit de Jong
September 20, 2021

The overarching learning objectives of this case are designed to help participants explore and understand 1) why to use data; 2) how to use data; and 3) what to do to become—and remain—a more informed city hall.

Read more

Lisa C. Cox and Jorrit de Jong

Eric Weinberger, Dan Levy, and Jorrit de Jong

The “Bilbao Effect” – The Collaborative Architecture that Powered Bilbao’s Urban Revival

Fernando Monge, Jorrit De Jong, and Linda Bilmes
May 18, 2020

Explores how cross-boundary collaboration mechanisms and different leadership styles enabled the city of Bilbao’s revival from a deep economic, political, and social crisis.

Read more

A Task Force With Teeth? Driving City Performance in Lawrence, Massachusetts.

Jorrit de Jong, Lisa Cox, Alex Green, and Warren Dent
May 19, 2020

Illustrates work by Mayor Daniel Rivera of Lawrence, Massachusetts, and his administration, to use data in decision-making around problem properties in the city.

“You Have One Hundred Days”: Accelerating Government Performance in the UAE

Fernando Monge, Jorrit de Jong, and Warren Dent
